summary: Clinical Documentation & RBAC Enhancement testing complete. All backend APIs (12/12 tests) and frontend UI flows passed. Fixed MongoDB ObjectId serialization bug in clinical_documentation_module.py. RBAC correctly enforces physician/nurse access to documentation tabs.

fixed_during_test.issue: MongoDB ObjectId not serializable causing 520 error when creating physician/nursing documentation
fixed_during_test.fix: Added doc_dict.pop('_id', None) after insert_one() for all document types

frontend_tests.login_flow: PASSED - Multi-step login (Region -> Hospital -> Location -> Credentials)
frontend_tests.confidentiality_notice: PASSED - Modal displayed on patient chart access with proper privacy warning
frontend_tests.acknowledge_button: PASSED - 'I Acknowledge & Proceed' button works correctly
frontend_tests.nursing_tab: PASSED - Tab visible for both physician and nurse
frontend_tests.physician_tab: PASSED - Tab visible for both physician and nurse
frontend_tests.rbac_physician: PASSED - Physician sees 'Add Documentation' on Physician tab, read-only on Nursing tab
frontend_tests.rbac_nurse: PASSED - Nurse sees 'Add Documentation' on Nursing tab, read-only on Physician tab
frontend_tests.create_physician_doc_form: PASSED - Full form with all fields (Doc Type, Title, Chief Complaint, HPI, PMH, Physical Exam, Assessment, Plan, Notes)

seed_data_creation: Test physician documentation created via backend API during testing
context_for_next_testing_agent: Clinical Documentation module fully tested. Both nursing and physician documentation CRUD operations work. RBAC enforced correctly - physicians cannot create nursing docs, nurses cannot create physician docs. Confidentiality notice modal working as expected. Test users at Ashaiman Polyclinic organization.
